TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit NavigationTermSetItem extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract base class for the and the objects.

remarks.para: This class is analogous to the class.
The NavigationTerm object and NavigationTermSet object have two modes: “editable” mode and “read-only” mode. See the method to learn more about modes.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CustomizableString CatalogTargetUrlForChildTerms { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CustomizableString CatalogTargetUrlForChildTerms
Public ReadOnly Property CatalogTargetUrlForChildTerms As CustomizableString
public: property Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::CustomizableString ^ CatalogTargetUrlForChildTerms { Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::CustomizableString ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the default value of the property for child objects.
Docs.value: The default value of the CatalogTargetUrl property

remarks.para: This property is a CustomizableString object. The default value is inherited from the CatalogTargetUrlForChildTerms.Value property of the parent object, or the if there is no parent term. For the NavigationTermSet object, the default value is an empty string.

The property does not affect the catalog target URL for the current object. If not customized, the default is inherited from a parent node instead. To disable the CatalogTargetUrl default for child nodes, assign an empty string to the .
The CatalogTargetUrl property is only meaningful when the property is .

example.para: Consider a website with a navigation term set object that should contain this hierarchy of terms.

Docs.param: The initial value for the property.
The initial value for the property.
The initial value for the property.
Docs.summary: Creates a new object with the specified .

remarks.para: Similar in concept to the method, this method creates a new navigation term with the specified name, link type, and taxonomy ID. The new term is a child of the current object.

The provided parameter is used to determine the name of the underlying object, which is a localized value. The locale ID is determined by the current property, which for multilingual sites should be configured before by using the method. If the specified name is already in use by a sibling term, a suffix will automatically be appended to avoid this conflict. A suitable will also be generated from this name, and in the same way, a suffix will be appended if necessary to avoid a sibling conflict. Where terms created using the are sorted alphabetically, the automatically updates the property to ensure that this term appears after the other custom-sorted terms.
This method is not supported if the property equals true.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTermSetItem GetAsEditable (Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TaxonomySession taxonomySession);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTermSetItem GetAsEditable(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TaxonomySession taxonomySession) cil managed
public: Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::NavigationTermSetItem ^ GetAsEditable(Microsoft::SharePoint::Taxonomy::TaxonomySession ^ taxonomySession);

Docs.param: The object for which to get a Term or TermSet object as editable.
Docs.summary: Returns an editable version of this object or object.
Docs.returns: An editable version of the object or an editable version of the object

remarks.para: The NavigationTerm and NavigationTermSet objects have two modes that reflect the most common usage patterns. In the “editable” mode, the object acts as a wrapper for the underlying analogous object in the N:Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy namespace, and the object can be freely modified. In the “read-only” mode, the object uses a limited lightweight representation that does not reference objects from a object. The “read-only” mode enables efficient storage in the taxonomy navigation cache and supports some traversal optimizations that improve performance when these optimizations are used with the object. The “read-only” mode is set by the property.

The method is used when the property equals true. It returns an editable version of this NavigationTerm object or NavigationTermSet object, which acts as a wrapper for the underlying or object from the TaxonomySession object that is provided.
Use the when IsReadOnly=true.

example.para: This example shows how to use the GetAsEditable method to add a new link to a NavigationTermSet object that was retrieved from the cache.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetResolvedDisplayUrl (string browserQueryString);
.method public hidebysig instance string GetResolvedDisplayUrl(string browserQueryString) cil managed
Public Function GetResolvedDisplayUrl (browserQueryString As String) As String
public: System::String ^ GetResolvedDisplayUrl(System::String ^ browserQueryString);

Docs.param: Optional. If it is provided, this query string is used as the query string part of the resulting URL. If this parameter is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or an empty string, it must be prefixed with the ? character.
Docs.summary: Returns the URL that is displayed in the navigation menus.
Docs.returns: A server-relative URL or an empty string.

remarks.para: Note: To obtain the target page address for a friendly URL, use the method instead. The returned URL is resolved by expanding any prefix tokens such as ~site/ or ~sitecollection/ which are used with properties such as and property.

The URL is derived differently depending on the value. If the term is of type , then the property is used. If the term is of type , then the friendly URL is used. For all other cases, null is returned.

remarks.para: For a object, the value will be a friendly URL or a simple link (heading).
For a object, the value is always .
Certain navigation properties are readable, but not modifiable for some link types. When assigning properties, you must assign the property before assigning properties such as or .

Docs.summary: Gets a string that specifies the default value of the target URL for child objects.
Docs.value: A string that specifies the default value of the target URL for child nodes

remarks.para: The property does not affect the current node.

This property is a CustomizableString object. The default value is inherited from the TargetUrlForChildTerms.Value property of the parent object or the object if there is no parent term. For the NavigationTermSet object, the default value is an empty string

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm> Terms { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm> Terms
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Terms As ReadOnlyCollection(Of NavigationTerm)

public: abstract property System::Collections::ObjectModel::ReadOnlyCollection<Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::NavigationTerm ^> ^ Terms { System::Collections::ObjectModel::ReadOnlyCollection<Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::NavigationTerm ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of all immediate child objects of this NavigationTerm object or object.
Docs.value: A collection of child terms belonging to this object

remarks.para: If this object is , then the property for the child objects point to this object. If the object is a , then the Parent property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for the top-level child terms.

The terms collection excludes some objects according to the trimming that is specified by the associated property. For example, if NavigationTermSetView.ExcludeDeprecatedTerms is true, then objects will be trimmed (i.e., excluded) from the collection if their property is true.

.property instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTermSetView View
Public ReadOnly Property View As NavigationTermSetView
public: property Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::NavigationTermSetView ^ View { Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::NavigationTermSetView ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a object that is used for various purposes such as to resolve relative URLs.

remarks.para: The view represents state that is obtained from the context of the object that is using the term set for its navigation.
The NavigationTermSetView object is read-only. To modify the view, make the changes to a copy obtained via the method, and then pass the new instance to the method or to the method.
